thread.title: CFMEU and MUA to merge
thread.title_full: CFMEU and MUA to merge | afr.com

author: Lucille Keen
title: CFMEU and MUA to merge
text:
The CFMEU and MUA are expected to announce they will merge. Glenn Hunt by Lucille Keen Two of Australia's most militant unions, the Construction, Forestry, Mining and Energy Union and the Maritime Union of Australia are expected to announce on Friday afternoon that they will merge.
The deal is being finalised between CFMEU national secretary Michael O'Connor and MUA national secretary Paddy Crumlin and will see all branches of the construction union incorporated into the new left-wing entity.
Sources have said the unions will release a statement on the merger on Friday afternoon.
Despite the MUA having a smaller number of members it is expected its financial position will help boost the CFMEU, which has faced millions of dollars of penalties from legal action. Recently it was forced to pay cement maker Boral up to $9 million in damages for an alleged secondary boycott .
More to come
